result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

02:02 PM Defendant Robert V Krueger in court with attorney J Andrew Herbers.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Case dismissed and read in to 22CM624.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter to Court requesting hearing on 8-19-22 be converted to a Plea and Sentencing Date, filed by Atty. Herbers.   **Reviewed by Judge Bohren on June 28, 2022 - Clerk to schedule for early date.**
Authorization to Appear filed in Court by Attorney J. Andrew Herbers Jr.

Case called at 11:03 AM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney J Andrew Herbers in court and appears by authorization.   Defendant Robert V Krueger did not appear.  
Attorney Herbers requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victims A & B (or their residence) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  The Defendant is allowed telephonic contact with victims A & B.  The Defendant to notify the Clerk's Office of new address by end of business day on 06/02/2022.

01:34 PM Defendant Robert V Krueger in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
The Defendant to notify the Clerk's Office of new address by end of business day on 06/02/2022.  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
